name: FireDaemon
overview:
Founded in 1999, FireDaemon Technologies Limited is the is the #1 vendor of Windows Service management software for professional and hosting use. We are a privately held corporation and have been successful in identifying and providing commercial and FOSS products such as FireDaemon Lite, FireDaemon Pro and FireDaemon Fusion, PanelDaemon and daeMON.

We are based in Cambridge, UK with our primary development office in Minsk, Belarus and a global network of resellers and partners to continually expand and support worldwide sales.

Who Are Our Customers

Google, NASA, Microsoft, Coca-Cola, FedEx, Harvard University, IBM, Honda and EA are amongst more than 40,000 organisations using FireDaemon to achieve 100% uptime and availability of their applications.

Over 90% of the Fortune 500 trust FireDaemon along with thousands of major organizations, institutions, universities and government agencies worldwide.

How did it get the name: FireDaemon?

A daemon is UNIX parlance for a computer program that runs in the background, rather than under the direct control of a user; they are usually instantiated as processes. Computer systems often start (or “launch”) daemons at boot time: they often serve the function of responding to network requests, hardware activity, or other programs by performing some task. Daemons can also configure hardware, run scheduled tasks, and perform a variety of other tasks.

Daemons are characters in Greek mythology, some of whom handled tasks that the gods couldn’t be bothered with, much like computer daemons often handle tasks in the background that the user can’t be bothered with. Later daemon was rationalized to the acronym: Disk And Execution MONitor.
